intro: Pouzolzia mandrarensis, commonly known as the Madagascar pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Pouzolzia mandrarensis is adapted to the arid and rocky environments of its native habitat.
